Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 11:02 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Roynon Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have now diverted power around the fault.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Roynon Close area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Roland at 10:40.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, Roland here. I understand that having a power cut over Christmas Day is especially difficult, as you may have celebrations planned which will be impacted by the lights going out. 

I wanted to reassure you that our office and field staff work 365 days a year to ensure that power cuts are fixed, and that you always have someone to speak to. Our engineers will restore your power as quickly as they can, and my team will update you with all of their progress.

If you have any concerns or want to speak to us about anything, call us any time on 08003163105 and press the option for power cuts.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:52 - Hi David here again.  I'm sorry for how long power was affected especially on Christmas Day. We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 275 customers in the RH5 5 area, by removing the trees that were laying on the overhead cables This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:03 - Hi David here again. I apologies for how long you've been without power especially on Christmas Day. I just wanted to give you the latest update. Our engineers are still on site in the Dorking, RH5 5 area working with the tree cutters to remove a large amount of trees that have fallen onto our overhead electrical cables. Once these are removed the engineers will work on repairs to the cables and restore your power. At the moment we don't need to change the estimated timeframe.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi David here again. Thanks for your patience today especially at this festive time. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather. Our engineers are still on site in the Dorking, RH5 5 area working to remove the tress that have fallen onto the overhead cables

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 03:51. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I am the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks in Ipswich. Today's power cut was unexpected, so we were unable to provide you with prior notice to help you plan ahead. I am pleased to confirm that we managed to resolve this by diverting power and connecting generators to get your lights back on as soon as possible. Just so you know, we text customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in the future you can do so here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L. This was a widespread problem on the overhead network and I personally apologise for any disruption this has caused to your day. If you have any questions or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 15:53 - We can now confirm that all power in the High Wycombe HP15 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around the grounded cables to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. These will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Lisa, Will, Aaron and Kevin are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Will at 20:02 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers isolated the fault on the underground network in the Du Cane Road W12 0 area, away from the main network. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 19:44 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 20:30 and 21:30 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 17:39 - Thanks for bearing with us over today. Our team of cable jointers have identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team are excavating the ground out, and this can take some time depending on the surface material, and how much space is needed to allow our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely. 

Our estimated time frame of 20:30 and 21:30 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.

Sent by Will at 16:25 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Lynton Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have isolated from the main network, allowing them to restore supplies.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Will at 15:29 - Thanks for bearing with us over today. Our team of cable jointers have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team will now begin excavations, and this can take some time depending on the surface material, and how much space is needed to allow our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely. 

Our estimated time frame of 17:00 and 18:00 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.

Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Will, Lisa, Aaron and Kev are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Sent by Lisa at 17:12 - Our staff have managed to restore power back to the Queens Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

We're very sorry for the repeated disruption, especially during the festive period.

If your power isn't on, or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, Lisa here again. I know multiple power cuts over the festive period can be tough, especially with celebrations planned for Christmas Day.

Rest assured, our teams work 365 days a year to fix power cuts and keep you informed. Our engineers will restore your power as quickly as possible, and my team will keep you updated every step of the way.

We hope you're managing okay without your power, but if you have any concerns or need to talk to us, call us anytime at 08003163105 and press the option for power cuts.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us we need to locate the fault before we can begin excavations.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 20:30 and 21:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Lisa at 15:39.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 14:36 - We can now confirm that all power in the West Hendon Broadway area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the West Hendon Broadway area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 14:33.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 14:14 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the West Hendon Broadway area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 17:30 and 18:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Thank you for your continued patience this evening.

Our engineers have advised that there has been a water leak within the affected block of flats. Due to this, they are not comfortable replacing the blown network equipment until the electrical equipment of the block of flats has been checked and deemed safe by a private electrician.

We are speaking with the local council and advising them of what needs to be done. Until this work has been carried out, our engineers won't be able to carry out any further work. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair.

We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change.

For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
